text: Thomas Townley Macan (born 1946) was Governor and Commander-in-Chief of the British Virgin Islands, an overseas territory of the United Kingdom in the Caribbean Sea, from 14 October 2002 to 10 April 2006. He was educated at Shrewsbury School and the University of Sussex. On the advice of the British government, he was appointed by Queen Elizabeth II to represent the Queen in the territory and to act as the de facto head of state. == References == Category:1946 births Category:Governors of the British Virgin Islands Category:Living people Category:People educated at Shrewsbury School Category:Alumni of the University of Sussex
title: Tom Macan
